</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Lambda-callbacks">Lambda callbacks<a class="anchor-link" href="#Lambda-callbacks">¶</a></h2><p><strong>Usage</strong> <code>tf.keras.callbacks.LambdaCallback(
        on_epoch_begin=None, on_epoch_end=None, 
        on_batch_begin=None, on_batch_end=None, 
        on_train_begin=None, on_train_end=None)</code></p>
<p>Lambda callbacks are used to quickly define simple custom callbacks with the use of lambda functions.</p>
<p>Each of the functions require some positional arguments.</p>
<ul>
<li><code>on_epoch_begin</code> and <code>on_epoch_end</code> expect two arguments: <code>epoch</code> and <code>logs</code>,</li>
<li><code>on_batch_begin</code> and <code>on_batch_end</code> expect two arguments: <code>batch</code> and <code>logs</code> and</li>
<li><code>on_train_begin</code> and <code>on_train_end</code> expect one argument: <code>logs</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p>Let's see an example of this in practice.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Print the epoch number at the beginning of each epoch</span>

<span class="n">epoch_callback</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keras</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LambdaCallback</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">on_epoch_begin</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">epoch</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">logs</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Starting Epoch </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">!'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">epoch</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Print the loss at the end of each batch</span>

<span class="n">batch_loss_callback</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keras</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LambdaCallback</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">on_batch_end</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">batch</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">logs</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1"> After batch </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">, the loss is </span><span class="si">{:7.2f}</span><span class="s1">.'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">batch</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logs</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'loss'</span><span class="p">])))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Inform that training is finished</span>

<span class="n">train_finish_callback</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keras</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LambdaCallback</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">on_train_end</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">logs</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Training finished!'</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Train the model with the lambda callbacks</span>

<span class="n">history</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">train_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">train_targets</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">epochs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">batch_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">,</span>
                    <span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">epoch_callback</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">batch_loss_callback</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">train_finish_callback</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">verbose</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Starting Epoch 1!

 After batch 0, the loss is 27667.97.

 After batch 1, the loss is 22613.94.

 After batch 2, the loss is 20599.06.

 After batch 3, the loss is 21963.30.
Starting Epoch 2!

 After batch 0, the loss is 20254.76.

 After batch 1, the loss is 29112.39.

 After batch 2, the loss is 22727.45.

 After batch 3, the loss is 20625.91.
Starting Epoch 3!

 After batch 0, the loss is 25232.80.

 After batch 1, the loss is 21077.61.

 After batch 2, the loss is 23792.37.

 After batch 3, the loss is 22593.09.
Starting Epoch 4!

 After batch 0, the loss is 23422.64.

 After batch 1, the loss is 20632.54.

 After batch 2, the loss is 25612.59.

 After batch 3, the loss is 22955.75.
Starting Epoch 5!

 After batch 0, the loss is 25442.62.

 After batch 1, the loss is 23722.53.

 After batch 2, the loss is 22604.90.

 After batch 3, the loss is 20703.36.
Training finished!
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Reduce-learning-rate-on-plateau">Reduce learning rate on plateau<a class="anchor-link" href="#Reduce-learning-rate-on-plateau">¶</a></h2><p><strong>Usage</strong> <code>tf.keras.callbacks.ReduceLROnPlateau(
            monitor='val_loss', 
            factor=0.1, 
            patience=10, 
            verbose=0, 
            mode='auto', 
            min_delta=0.0001, 
            cooldown=0, 
            min_lr=0)</code></p>
<p>The <code>ReduceLROnPlateau</code> callback allows reduction of the learning rate when a metric has stopped improving. 
The arguments are similar to those used in the <code>EarlyStopping</code> callback.</p>
<ul>
<li>The argument <code>monitor</code> is used to specify which metric to base the callback on.</li>
<li>The <code>factor</code> is the factor by which the learning rate decreases i.e., new_lr=factor*old_lr.</li>
<li>The <code>patience</code> is the number of epochs where there is no improvement on the monitored metric before the learning rate is reduced.</li>
<li>The <code>verbose</code> argument will produce progress messages when set to 1.</li>
<li>The <code>mode</code> determines whether the learning rate will decrease when the monitored quantity stops increasing (<code>max</code>) or decreasing (<code>min</code>). The <code>auto</code> setting causes the callback to infer the mode from the monitored quantity.</li>
<li>The <code>min_delta</code> is the smallest change in the monitored quantity to be deemed an improvement.</li>
<li>The <code>cooldown</code> is the number of epochs to wait after the learning rate is changed before the callback resumes normal operation.</li>
<li>The <code>min_lr</code> is a lower bound on the learning rate that the callback will produce.</li>
</ul>
<p>Let's examine a final example.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Train the model with the ReduceLROnPlateau callback</span>

<span class="n">history</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">train_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">train_targets</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">epochs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">batch_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">,</span>
                    <span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keras</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">callbacks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ReduceLROnPlateau</span><span class="p">(</span>
                        <span class="n">monitor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"loss"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">factor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">verbose</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)],</span> <span class="n">verbose</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Further-reading-and-resources">Further reading and resources<a class="anchor-link" href="#Further-reading-and-resources">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li><a href="https://keras.io/callbacks/">https://keras.io/callbacks/</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LearningRateScheduler">https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LearningRateScheduler</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/CSVLogger">https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/CSVLogger</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LambdaCallback">https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LambdaCallback</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
    </div>
  </div>
</body>

 


</html>

item.title: Win10安装Ubuntu子系统
item.description:
介绍

在win10系统上安装Ubuntu子系统及GUI。

安装Ubuntu子系统

  1. 以管理员身份打开PowerShell
  2. 为Linux启用win10子系统 
    dism.exe /online /enable-feature /featurename:Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux /all /norestart
  3. 启用虚拟机功能 
    dism.exe /online /enable-feature /featurename:VirtualMachinePlatform /all /norestart
  4. 重启计算机，打开启用或关闭Windows功能检查是否启用win10子系统和虚拟机功能。
  5. 下载Linux内核更新程序x64版本
  6. 将WSL2设置为默认版本 
    wsl --set-default-version 2
  7. 打开应用商店，安装Ubuntu。
  8. 安装成功，检查版本是否为version 2。

    安装GUI

  9. 更新系统 
    sudo apt update && sudo apt -y upgrade
  10. 安装xfce4 
    sudo apt-get install xrdp
sudo apt-get install xfce4
sudo apt-get install xfce4-goodies
  11. 修改配置文件 
    sudo cp /etc/xrdp/xrdp.ini /etc/xrdp/xrdp.ini.bak
sudo sed -i 's/3389/3390/g' /etc/xrdp/xrdp.ini
sudo sed -i 's/max_bpp=32/#max_bpp=32\nmax_bpp=128/g' /etc/xrdp/xrdp.ini
sudo sed -i 's/xserverbpp=24/#xserverbpp=24\nxserverbpp=128/g' /etc/xrdp/xrdp.ini
echo xfce4-session > ~/.xsession
  12. 编辑/etc/xrdp/startwm.sh文件 
    sudo nano /etc/xrdp/startwm.sh
  # 注释下面两行
#test -x /etc/X11/Xsession && exec /etc/X11/Xsession
#exec /bin/sh /etc/X11/Xsession
  # 添加下面两行
# xfce
startxfce4
  13. 启动xrdp sudo /etc/init.d/xrdp start

    打开window远程桌面连接

    输入localhost:3390, 输入用户名密码即可登录。

    常见问题

    Q. 浏览器打不开出现一下错误

    Failed to execute to default Web Browser.

    A. 重新安装firefox浏览器 sudo apt-get install firefox

参考链接

1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IL7Jd9rjgrM&ab_channel=DavidBombal
2. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-win10
3. https://dev.to/darksmile92/linux-on-windows-wsl-with-desktop-environment-via-rdp-522g
